meanings.definition: To specify or identify something in detail.
meanings.sent1: She was particularizing the instructions for the project.
meanings.sent2: The detective was particularizing the suspect's whereabouts at the time of the crime.
meanings.sent3: By particularizing the ingredients, she accidentally left out the most important one.
meanings.sent4: His attention to detail in particularizing each brushstroke made his painting come to life.
meanings.sent5: The botanist was particularizing the unique characteristics of the rare flower species.

meanings.definition: To focus on or emphasize specific details.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was particularizing the key points of the lesson for the students.
meanings.sent2: The journalist was particularizing the important facts in the article.
meanings.sent3: By particularizing the minor flaws, he missed the overall beauty of the artwork.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were particularizing every movement of the dancer on stage.
meanings.sent5: The chef was particularizing the seasoning to enhance the flavor of the dish.

meanings.definition: To make something distinct or individual.
meanings.sent1: The artist was particularizing each sculpture to reflect a different emotion.
meanings.sent2: The tailor was particularizing the measurements for a custom-fit suit.
meanings.sent3: By particularizing the design, she created a dress that stood out from the rest.
meanings.sent4: His storytelling was particularizing each character, bringing them to life in the listeners' minds.
meanings.sent5: The architect was particularizing the features of the building to give it a unique identity.
